metadata.title: CVE-2021-3483 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Nosy driver in the Linux kernel. This issue allowsa device to be inserted twice into a doubly-linked list, leading to ause-after-free when one of these devices is removed. The highest threatfrom this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as systemavailability. Versions before kernel 5.12-rc6 are affected

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
